question:
You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable and can be displayed.
Please help me implement this SVG image using code. A vector illustration featuring a hand with a thumbs up icon, juxtaposed with a thumbs down icon.

checklist.title: Is the SVG structure correctly implemented with proper vector graphics?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements SVG elements using proper vector graphics principles, including correct use of paths, shapes, and coordinate systems for both thumbs up and thumbs down icons. Check if the hand anatomy is proportionally correct and visually recognizable. Score 0 if basic SVG structure is missing, 5 if only basic shapes are used without proper hand details, and 10 if anatomically accurate hands with proper thumb positioning are fully implemented.

checklist.title: Are both thumbs up and thumbs down icons properly juxtaposed and balanced?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether both icons are implemented with proper visual balance, symmetry, and clear distinction. Check if the positioning creates effective visual contrast and the composition follows design principles. The icons should be easily distinguishable and properly aligned. Deduct 5 points if only one icon is implemented, 3 points if the positioning lacks visual balance, and 2 points if the icons are too similar in appearance. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the vector illustration optimized and scalable?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG uses proper vector optimization techniques including minimal path points, efficient use of geometric shapes, and scalable design principles. Evaluate if the illustration maintains visual quality at different sizes and uses appropriate stroke-width and fill properties. Deduct 5 points if the SVG uses excessive path points or redundant elements, 3 points if scaling issues are present, and 2 points if stroke-width is not properly defined. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the implementation include proper semantic structure and accessibility?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG includes proper semantic elements such as title, description, and appropriate grouping with <g> elements. Check if accessibility attributes like aria-labels, role definitions, and meaningful element IDs are implemented. Deduct 5 points if no semantic structure is present, 3 points if accessibility attributes are missing, and 2 points if element grouping is poorly organized. Give 10 points if fully implemented with proper semantic structure.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common issues such as browser compatibility, invalid SVG syntax, missing viewBox attributes, and proper namespace declarations. Code with strong robustness should include fallback mechanisms and proper error handling for SVG rendering issues, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no error handling or compatibility considerations are present, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the visual experience (e.g., 1. Interactive hover effects with CSS animations 2. Gradient fills or shadow effects 3. Responsive design adaptations 4. Smooth transition animations between states). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements or duplicate paths 2. Unnecessary styling or effects that don't enhance the core illustration 3. Overly complex implementations where simple solutions would suffice. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core illustration clarity is compromised by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review code organization (such as proper SVG grouping, consistent naming conventions, and clean structure), reusability of components, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if inconsistent naming or poor code organization is found; deduct 5 points if the code structure is not modular or reusable; deduct 5 points if the SVG lacks proper documentation or comments. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional illustration standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern vector illustration principles: 1) Harmonious color palette with proper contrast ratios 2) Consistent line weights and styling 3) Professional iconographic design with clear visual hierarchy 4) Proper proportions and anatomical accuracy for hand representation. Deduct 3 points for each visual inconsistency, 5 points for poor color choices or contrast, and 5 points for anatomically incorrect or unprofessional appearance. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the SVG rendering performance optimized and display quality excellent?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG renders smoothly across different devices and browsers: 1) Proper viewBox and aspect ratio settings 2) Optimized file size without quality loss 3) Sharp rendering at various zoom levels 4) Consistent appearance across different browsers. Deduct 5 points for rendering issues or pixelation, 3 points for poor performance or large file size, and 5 points for inconsistent cross-browser appearance. The full score is 10 points.
